搶.definition: to fight over; to rush; to scramble; to grab; to rob; to snatch

搶修.definition: to repair in a rush; rush repairs

搶先.definition: to rush (to do sth urgent); to try to be the first; to forestall

搶功.definition: to take credit for sb else's achievements

搶奪.definition: to plunder; to pillage; to forcibly take

搶斷.definition: (basketball) to steal (the ball); (soccer) to dispossess an opponent (by tackling or intercepting a pass)

搶灘.definition: to make an amphibious assault; to seize a beachhead; to gain a foothold in (a new market)

搶生意.definition: to undercut competitors; to hustle; to compete for business

搶答.definition: to compete to be the first to answer a question (as on a quiz show)

搶答器.definition: lockout buzzer system (as used by game show contestants)

搶註.definition: to squat on (a domain name, trademark etc)

搶購.definition: to buy frenetically; to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)

搶走.definition: to snatch (esp related to a robbery)

搶跑.definition: to jump the gun; to make a false start

搶通.definition: to rush through urgently (e.g. emergency supplies)

搶鏡頭.definition: to scoop the best camera shots; to grab the limelight

搶險.definition: emergency (measures); to react to an emergency

搶險救災.definition: to provide relief during times of emergency and disaster (idiom)

搶風頭.definition: to steal the show; to grab the limelight
